lines.text: I'd give my right eye.
It would turn out to be glass!
What would you do for 100 Grand?
What wouldn't I do?
You're the kind of guy that would steal two left shoes!

[as Joan enters]
Cigarette?
No, thanks.
You know, I've been thinkin' about you, Baby.
I wish you wouldn't, Jimmy.
What?
Think about me.
What's the matter?
I'm liable to catch something hanging out in your mind.
Eddie, money don't talk! It speaks right out loud!
Baby, what would you do for five hundred bucks?
I'd do my best.
You'd better give this case your personal attention.
I'll get on it right away before Jimmy Corrigan and his Tarzans get wind of it.
Wait a minute. Corrigan doesn't get any... tips from the emergency.
I don't trust him! He'd bribe a corpse to sit up and telephone!
You don't care what anybody does! It's just getting caught!
What's the matter with that? Im in business, aren't I?
I'll say! Crooked business!
Oh, all business is crooked!
Signed Jimmy Corrigan, the boy with the worm's eye view!
There's only two kinds of guys in business - those who get caught and those who on't!

[Gladys laughs]
I knew we'd get along.
[He laughs]
Now listen, Babe. Tell me, Gladys, what would you do for a nice big piece of change?
Hunh! What wouldn't I do!
Yeah, we know all about that, but this is business.
All right, so it's business. How do I snag this dough?
By not testifying against Joe Rector.
Say, listen, I'll send that hyena to the chair and put a tack on it!

[to Jimmy]
You're the greatest chiseler since Michaelangelo!
You won't think any less of me, Big Baby, fer forgettin' the ring?

[Walking away from him]
That's all right. When you shed your skin, send me the rattles.

[to Wallingham]
Are we sitting pretty or are we sitting pretty?

[In a French accent]
Au revoir, Cunningham.

[In a New York accent]
Fillette Mignon, Wallingham.

[as she is crying]
Joan, dear, I'm a bit gauche at this sort of thing, but why don't you let me take care of you?

[Shocked]
Mr. Wallingham!
Oh, don't "Mister" me, please, as I've grown very fond of you.
Mr. Wallingham!

[Said as a double entendre]
I've tried to make you... really mine.
Hello, Baby. I was just gonna give yuh a ring.
[He notices she is just glaring at him]
What's the matter?

[Contemptuously]
You go down deeper, stay under longer, and come up dirtier than any man I've ever known!
Make me respect you.

[working the switchboard]
Hello Mr. Corrigan's office. Mrs.Greenbaum? Oh, I thought I reckonized your voice... Huh? Oh, you wanna know if Mr. Corrigan sent you that copy of your aunt's will? Just a sec...
[turning to her coworker]
Hey Jitters, has that gone out yet?

[irritated]
No it ain't. Whaddya think I am? An octopus with a thousand hands or somethin'?
Sure, Mrs. Greenbaum, it's in the mail... You're welcome.

[Speaking of Wallingham]
He bothers you, doesn't he?
Yeah, like a crumb in a union suit!
Well, it'll always bother you. Jimmy, he's got something you haven't.
The only thing he's got that I want is you, and he took you away from me.

[to Lou]
Now, look, you beat it down to the Farm Owner's Trust Company and bribe that dumb, bald man to give you the dope on that old lady! Get it?
[Pointing a threatening finger]
And look, if you miss anything, you get lumps!

[Starting to pour her a drink]
Say when.

[Clueless]
Whattya mean?
Let it go.
Louie says you're a prince.
Are you sure he said "Prince"?
